docs.title: Grammar Lessons
docs.text:

docs.title: Future Tense Exercises
docs.text: Practice expressing future actions with will, going to, and present continuous!

docs.title: Exercise 1: Will vs Going to
docs.text:
Choose the correct form based on the context.

Exercise

  1. A: The phone is ringing! B: I _ (answer) it!
  2. a) will answer

  3. b) am going to answer

  4. Look at those dark clouds! It _ (rain) soon.

  5. a) will rain

  6. b) is going to rain

  7. I promise I _ (help) you with your homework.

  8. a) will help

  9. b) am going to help

  10. She has already bought the tickets. She _ (travel) to Paris next month.

  11. a) will travel

  12. b) is going to travel

  13. A: I don't have any money. B: Don't worry, I _ (lend) you some.

  14. a) will lend
  15. b) am going to lend
Answers
  1. a) will answer (spontaneous decision)
  2. b) is going to rain (prediction with evidence)
  3. a) will help (promise)
  4. b) is going to travel (plan/intention)
  5. a) will lend (spontaneous offer)

docs.title: Exercise 2: Complete the Sentences
docs.text:
Fill in the blanks with the correct future form.

Exercise

  1. Tomorrow, I _ (wake up) early to catch the bus.
  2. Look at him! He _ (fall) off his bike!
  3. We _ (have) dinner at the new restaurant tonight. I already made a reservation.
  4. Don't worry about the dishes. I _ (wash) them later.
  5. She _ (study) medicine when she finishes high school.
  6. I think robots _ (do) most of our work in the future.
  7. They _ (fly) to Japan next week. Their flight is on Tuesday.
  8. A: It's cold in here. B: I _ (close) the window.
Answers
  1. will wake up / am going to wake up
  2. is going to fall
  3. are having
  4. will wash
  5. is going to study
  6. will do
  7. are flying
  8. will close

docs.title: Exercise 3: Make Predictions
docs.text:
Write predictions using "will" or "going to" based on the evidence.

Exercise

  1. The sky is very dark and cloudy. → It _
  2. Scientists are working on new technology. → In the future, cars _
  3. She's carrying a lot of books and looks tired. → She _
  4. There's no food in the refrigerator. → We _
  5. He's studying very hard for the exam. → He _
Answers
  1. It's going to rain.
  2. In the future, cars will be electric/autonomous.
  3. She's going to drop them.
  4. We're going to order food/go shopping.
  5. He's going to pass the exam.

docs.title: Exercise 4: Future Arrangements
docs.text:
Complete the conversations using present continuous for future arrangements.

Exercise

  1. A: What _ you _ (do) tomorrow evening? B: I _ (meet) my friends at the cinema.

  2. A: _ Sarah _ (come) to the party? B: Yes, she _ (bring) her sister too.

  3. A: When _ you _ (leave) for vacation? B: We _ (fly) next Friday morning.

  4. A: _ they _ (work) this weekend? B: No, they _ (relax) at home.

Answers
  1. are / doing / am meeting
  2. Is / coming / is bringing
  3. are / leaving / are flying
  4. Are / working / are relaxing

docs.title: Exercise 5: Future Time Expressions
docs.text:
Match the sentences with the appropriate time expressions.

Time Expressions

tomorrow | next week | in 2 hours | soon | later | tonight | next year | this afternoon

Exercise

  1. I'll call you _. I'm busy right now.
  2. The movie starts _. We should leave now.
  3. She's going to graduate _.
  4. They're having a meeting _.
  5. We're going to the beach _.
  6. The doctor will see you _.
  7. I'm going to finish this project _.
  8. Don't worry, help will arrive _.
Answers
  1. later
  2. in 2 hours
  3. next year
  4. this afternoon
  5. tomorrow / next week
  6. soon
  7. tonight / tomorrow
  8. soon

docs.title: Exercise 6: Question Formation
docs.text:
Transform these statements into questions.

Exercise

  1. She will arrive at 8 PM. → ?
  2. They are going to buy a new car. → ?
  3. You are meeting him tomorrow. → ?
  4. It will rain tomorrow. → ?
  5. We are going to have a party. → ?
Answers
  1. Will she arrive at 8 PM?
  2. Are they going to buy a new car?
  3. Are you meeting him tomorrow?
  4. Will it rain tomorrow?
  5. Are we going to have a party?

docs.title: Exercise 7: Mixed Future Forms
docs.text:
Choose the best future form for each situation.

Exercise

  1. A: I've decided to learn French. B: That's great! I _ (help) you practice.

  2. According to the weather forecast, it _ (be) sunny tomorrow.

  3. I can't come to the meeting. I _ (take) my son to the doctor.

  4. A: The printer isn't working. B: Don't worry, I _ (fix) it.

  5. She has saved money for two years. She _ (buy) a new apartment.

  6. I think people _ (live) on Mars in the future.

  7. We _ (have) lunch with my parents on Sunday. They're expecting us.

  8. Look out! That tree _ (fall)!

Answers
  1. will help (spontaneous offer)
  2. will be (prediction/forecast)
  3. am taking (fixed arrangement)
  4. will fix (spontaneous decision)
  5. is going to buy (plan/intention)
  6. will live (prediction)
  7. are having (arrangement)
  8. is going to fall (prediction with evidence)

docs.title: Exercise 8: Future Continuous
docs.text:
Complete with future continuous (will be + verb-ing).

Exercise

  1. This time tomorrow, I _ (fly) to New York.
  2. At 8 PM tonight, we _ (watch) the game.
  3. Next month, she _ (work) in the new office.
  4. Don't call me at 3 PM. I _ (have) a meeting.
  5. In five years, they _ (live) in their dream house.
Answers
  1. will be flying
  2. will be watching
  3. will be working
  4. will be having
  5. will be living

Study Tips

  • Will: spontaneous decisions, promises, predictions
  • Going to: plans, intentions, predictions with evidence
  • Present Continuous: fixed arrangements and definite plans
  • Pay attention to context clues to choose the right form!

docs.title: Past Tense Exercises
docs.text: Master the past tense with these comprehensive exercises!

docs.title: Exercise 1: Regular vs Irregular Verbs
docs.text:
Complete the sentences with the past form of the verbs in parentheses.

Exercise

  1. Yesterday, I _ (visit) my grandmother.
  2. She _ (go) to the supermarket this morning.
  3. They _ (watch) a movie last night.
  4. He _ (eat) pizza for lunch.
  5. We _ (study) until midnight.
  6. The children _ (play) in the park.
  7. I _ (see) a beautiful bird in the garden.
  8. She _ (finish) her work at 6 PM.
Answers
  1. visited (regular)
  2. went (irregular - go/went)
  3. watched (regular)
  4. ate (irregular - eat/ate)
  5. studied (regular)
  6. played (regular)
  7. saw (irregular - see/saw)
  8. finished (regular)

docs.title: Exercise 2: Past Simple Negative and Questions
docs.text:
Transform these sentences into negative and question forms.

Exercise

Positive: She worked late yesterday.

  1. Negative: _
  2. Question: _

Positive: They went to the beach.

  1. Negative: _
  2. Question: _

Positive: I liked the movie.

  1. Negative: _
  2. Question: _
Answers
  1. She didn't work late yesterday.
  2. Did she work late yesterday?
  3. They didn't go to the beach.
  4. Did they go to the beach?
  5. I didn't like the movie.
  6. Did you like the movie?

docs.title: Exercise 3: Past Continuous
docs.text:
Complete with the past continuous form of the verbs.

Exercise

  1. At 8 PM yesterday, I _ (watch) TV.
  2. While she _ (cook), the phone rang.
  3. They _ (not/sleep) when I arrived.
  4. _ you _ (work) at 3 PM yesterday?
  5. We _ (walk) in the park when it started to rain.
  6. He _ (not/pay) attention during the meeting.
Answers
  1. was watching
  2. was cooking
  3. weren't sleeping
  4. Were / working
  5. were walking
  6. wasn't paying

docs.title: Exercise 4: Past Simple vs Past Continuous
docs.text:
Choose the correct form for each sentence.

Exercise

  1. I _ (read) a book when the doorbell _ (ring).
  2. She _ (work) in London from 2015 to 2020.
  3. While they _ (have) dinner, someone _ (knock) on the door.
  4. Yesterday, we _ (go) to the cinema and _ (watch) a great film.
  5. He _ (drive) to work when he _ (see) the accident.
  6. Last year, I _ (travel) to five different countries.
Answers
  1. was reading / rang
  2. worked
  3. were having / knocked
  4. went / watched
  5. was driving / saw
  6. traveled

docs.title: Exercise 5: Irregular Verbs Challenge
docs.text:
Write the past form of these irregular verbs.

Exercise

Present Past Present Past bring _____ know _____ buy _____ leave _____ catch _____ lose _____ choose _____ make _____ come _____ meet _____ drink _____ put _____ drive _____ run _____ find _____ take _____ forget _____ think _____ get _____ write _____ Answers Present Past Present Past bring brought know knew buy bought leave left catch caught lose lost choose chose make made come came meet met drink drank put put drive drove run ran find found take took forget forgot think thought get got write wrote

docs.title: Exercise 6: Story Completion
docs.text:
Complete this story using past tense verbs (simple and continuous).

Exercise

Last Saturday, Maria _ (wake up) early because she _ (plan) to visit her friend Ana. While she _ (have) breakfast, her phone _ (ring). It _ (be) Ana!

"Hi Maria! I _ (wait) for you at the bus station when I _ (realize) I _ (forget) my wallet at home," Ana _ (say).

Maria _ (laugh) and _ (decide) to pick up Ana by car instead. When she _ (arrive) at Ana's house, Ana _ (look) for her wallet everywhere. Finally, they _ (find) it under the sofa!

They _ (spend) a wonderful day together at the shopping mall, where they _ (buy) new clothes and _ (eat) delicious ice cream.

Answers

Last Saturday, Maria woke up early because she was planning to visit her friend Ana. While she was having breakfast, her phone rang. It was Ana!

"Hi Maria! I was waiting for you at the bus station when I realized I had forgotten my wallet at home," Ana said.

Maria laughed and decided to pick up Ana by car instead. When she arrived at Ana's house, Ana was looking for her wallet everywhere. Finally, they found it under the sofa!

They spent a wonderful day together at the shopping mall, where they bought new clothes and ate delicious ice cream.

docs.title: Exercise 7: Error Correction
docs.text:
Find and correct the mistakes in these past tense sentences.

Exercise

  1. I goed to the store yesterday.
  2. She was cook dinner when I arrived.
  3. Did you saw the movie last night?
  4. They didn't went to school.
  5. While he was drive, it started to rain.
  6. We was playing soccer in the park.
  7. I cutted the paper with scissors.
  8. She didn't knew the answer.
Answers
  1. I went to the store yesterday.
  2. She was cooking dinner when I arrived.
  3. Did you see the movie last night?
  4. They didn't go to school.
  5. While he was driving, it started to rain.
  6. We were playing soccer in the park.
  7. I cut the paper with scissors.
  8. She didn't know the answer.

Study Tips

  • Learn irregular verbs in groups by sound patterns
  • Use past continuous for background actions
  • Use past simple for completed actions
  • Remember: didn't + base verb (not past form)

docs.title: Present Tense Exercises
docs.text: Practice your present tense skills with these interactive exercises!

docs.title: Exercise 1: Simple Present - Fill in the Blanks
docs.text:
Complete the sentences with the correct form of the verb in parentheses.

Exercise

  1. Maria _ (work) in a hospital.
  2. They _ (not/like) spicy food.
  3. _ you _ (speak) English?
  4. The sun _ (rise) in the east.
  5. My brother _ (play) soccer every weekend.
  6. We _ (not/watch) TV during dinner.
  7. _ she _ (study) at university?
  8. Cats _ (love) to sleep in the sun.
Answers
  1. works
  2. don't like
  3. Do / speak
  4. rises
  5. plays
  6. don't watch
  7. Does / study
  8. love

docs.title: Exercise 2: Present Continuous - Choose the Correct Answer
docs.text:
Select the correct option for each sentence.

Exercise

  1. Right now, I _ my homework.

    • a) do
    • b) am doing
    • c) does

  2. Look! The children _ in the park.

    • a) are playing
    • b) plays
    • c) play

  3. She _ to music at the moment.

    • a) listen
    • b) listens
    • c) is listening

  4. We _ dinner right now.

    • a) are having
    • b) have
    • c) has

  5. _ you _ TV?

    • a) Do / watch
    • b) Are / watching
    • c) Is / watching
Answers
  1. b) am doing
  2. a) are playing
  3. c) is listening
  4. a) are having
  5. b) Are / watching

docs.title: Exercise 3: Simple Present vs Present Continuous
docs.text:
Choose between simple present and present continuous.

Exercise

  1. I usually _ (drink) coffee in the morning, but today I _ (drink) tea.
  2. She _ (work) in an office, but this week she _ (work) from home.
  3. They _ (live) in São Paulo, but they _ (visit) Rio right now.
  4. He _ (not/like) vegetables, but today he _ (eat) a salad.
  5. We _ (study) English every day, and right now we _ (do) exercises.
Answers
  1. drink / am drinking
  2. works / is working
  3. live / are visiting
  4. doesn't like / is eating
  5. study / are doing

docs.title: Exercise 4: Error Correction
docs.text:
Find and correct the mistakes in these sentences.

Exercise

  1. She are working in the garden.
  2. Do he speaks French?
  3. I am not liking this movie.
  4. They doesn't have any pets.
  5. What are you do right now?
  6. He work in a bank.
  7. Are she coming to the party?
  8. I am study English every day.
Answers
  1. She is working in the garden.
  2. Does he speak French?
  3. I don't like this movie.
  4. They don't have any pets.
  5. What are you doing right now?
  6. He works in a bank.
  7. Is she coming to the party?
  8. I study English every day.

docs.title: Exercise 5: Make Questions
docs.text:
Transform these statements into questions.

Exercise

  1. She lives in London. → ?
  2. They are watching TV. → ?
  3. You speak Portuguese. → ?
  4. He is cooking dinner. → ?
  5. We work on weekends. → ?
Answers
  1. Does she live in London?
  2. Are they watching TV?
  3. Do you speak Portuguese?
  4. Is he cooking dinner?
  5. Do we work on weekends?

docs.title: Exercise 6: Time Expressions
docs.text:
Complete with the appropriate time expression from the box.

Word Bank

now | every day | at the moment | usually | right now | always

Exercise

  1. I _ brush my teeth before bed.
  2. She is studying _. Don't disturb her.
  3. We _ go to the gym in the evening.
  4. They are having lunch _.
  5. He _ arrives late to meetings.
  6. I drink coffee _.
Answers
  1. always
  2. at the moment / right now / now
  3. usually
  4. now / right now / at the moment
  5. always
  6. every day

Study Tips

  • Remember: Simple Present for habits and facts
  • Present Continuous for actions happening now
  • Third person singular (he/she/it) adds -s in Simple Present
  • Use am/is/are + verb-ing for Present Continuous

docs.title: Future Tense
docs.text: English has several ways to express future actions and plans.

docs.title: Form
docs.text:
• Positive: Subject + will + base verb
  • Negative: Subject + will not (won't) + base verb
  • Question: Will + subject + base verb?

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
=== "Positive" - I will work tomorrow - She will study tonight - They will arrive at 8 PM

=== "Negative" - I won't work on Sunday - He won't come to the party - We won't be late

=== "Questions" - Will you work tomorrow? - Will she finish on time? - Will they be here soon?

docs.title: Form
docs.text:
• Positive: Subject + am/is/are + going to + base verb
  • Negative: Subject + am/is/are + not + going to + base verb
  • Question: Am/Is/Are + subject + going to + base verb?

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
=== "Positive" - I am going to work late today - She is going to study abroad - They are going to buy a new car

=== "Negative" - I am not going to work tomorrow - He isn't going to come - We aren't going to be late

=== "Questions" - Are you going to work tomorrow? - Is she going to finish today? - Are they going to be here?

docs.title: Form
docs.text: Same as present continuous, but with future time expressions.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• I am meeting my friend tomorrow
  • She is leaving next week
  • We are having dinner at 7 PM

docs.title: When to Use Each
docs.text:
Will

  • Spontaneous decisions: I'll help you with that!
  • Promises: I will call you tomorrow
  • Predictions without evidence: It will rain tomorrow
  • Offers: Will you have some coffee?

Going to

  • Plans and intentions: I'm going to learn Spanish
  • Predictions with evidence: Look at those clouds! It's going to rain
  • Near future: I'm going to be late!

Present Continuous

  • Fixed arrangements: I'm meeting the doctor at 3 PM
  • Definite plans: We're flying to Paris next month

docs.title: Time Expressions
docs.text: Expression Example tomorrow I will work tomorrow next week/month/year She's going to travel next month in + time They will arrive in 2 hours at + time We're meeting at 5 PM on + day/date I'm working on Monday soon He will be here soon later I'll call you later

docs.title: Form
docs.text: • Positive: Subject + will be + verb + ing

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
• At 8 PM, I will be watching TV
  • This time tomorrow, she will be flying to London
  • Next week, we will be working on the new project

Quick Tip

Will is more formal and used in writing. Going to is more common in spoken English.

docs.title: Common Mistakes
docs.text:
Avoid These Errors

  • ❌ I will going to work → ✅ I will work / I'm going to work
  • ❌ Will you going? → ✅ Will you go? / Are you going?
  • ❌ I will to help you → ✅ I will help you

docs.title: Past Tense
docs.text: The past tense is used to describe actions that happened in the past.

docs.title: Form
docs.text:
• Regular verbs: base verb + ed
  • Irregular verbs: special past forms
  • Negative: Subject + didn't + base verb
  • Question: Did + subject + base verb?

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
=== "Regular Verbs" - I worked yesterday - She studied all night - They watched a movie

=== "Irregular Verbs" - I went to the store - He ate lunch at noon - We saw a great film

=== "Negative" - I didn't work yesterday - She didn't go to school - They didn't see the accident

=== "Questions" - Did you work yesterday? - Did she finish her homework? - Did they enjoy the party?

docs.title: Form
docs.text:
• Positive: Subject + was/were + verb + ing
  • Negative: Subject + was/were + not + verb + ing
  • Question: Was/Were + subject + verb + ing?

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
=== "Positive" - I was working when you called - She was studying at 10 PM - They were playing soccer

=== "Negative" - I wasn't working at that time - He wasn't sleeping well - We weren't watching TV

=== "Questions" - Were you working yesterday at 3 PM? - Was she studying when I arrived? - Were they playing music?

docs.title: Common Irregular Verbs
docs.text: Base Form Past Simple Meaning go went ir see saw ver eat ate comer drink drank beber come came vir take took pegar/levar make made fazer get got conseguir/pegar give gave dar have had ter

docs.title: When to Use Each
docs.text:
Simple Past

  • Completed actions: I finished my work at 5 PM
  • Past habits: When I was young, I played soccer
  • Sequences: I woke up, had breakfast, and left

Past Continuous

  • Actions in progress: I was reading when you arrived
  • Background actions: While I was cooking, the phone rang
  • Interrupted actions: I was sleeping when the alarm went off

docs.title: Time Expressions
docs.text:
Simple Past Past Continuous yesterday, last week/month/year at 3 PM yesterday in 2020, ago, when I was young while, when (for interruptions) this morning (if it's now afternoon) all day yesterday, from 2 to 4 PM

Spelling Rules for -ed

  • Most verbs: work → worked
  • Verbs ending in -e: like → liked
  • Short verbs ending in consonant: stop → stopped

docs.title: Present Tense
docs.text: The present tense is used to describe actions happening now, habits, or general truths.

docs.title: Form
docs.text:
• Positive: Subject + base verb (+ s/es for 3rd person singular)
  • Negative: Subject + do/does + not + base verb
  • Question: Do/Does + subject + base verb?

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
=== "Positive" - I work in an office - She studies English every day - They live in Brazil

=== "Negative" - I don't work on weekends - He doesn't like coffee - We don't watch TV at night

=== "Questions" - Do you speak Portuguese? - Does she work here? - Do they have children?

docs.title: Form
docs.text:
• Positive: Subject + am/is/are + verb + ing
  • Negative: Subject + am/is/are + not + verb + ing
  • Question: Am/Is/Are + subject + verb + ing?

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
=== "Positive" - I am working right now - She is studying for her exam - They are playing soccer

=== "Negative" - I am not working today - He isn't sleeping - We aren't watching TV

=== "Questions" - Are you working now? - Is she coming to the party? - Are they studying English?

docs.title: When to Use Each
docs.text:
Simple Present

  • Habits: I drink coffee every morning
  • Facts: The sun rises in the east
  • Schedules: The train leaves at 8 AM

Present Continuous

  • Now: I'm reading a book right now
  • Temporary: She's working in London this month
  • Future plans: We're meeting tomorrow

docs.title: Common Time Expressions
docs.text:
Simple Present Present Continuous always, usually, often now, right now, at the moment sometimes, rarely, never today, this week, this month every day/week/month currently, these days

Spelling Rules for -ing

  • Most verbs: work → working
  • Verbs ending in -e: make → making
  • Short verbs ending in consonant: run → running, sit → sitting
